This place is perfectly located, very close to Durbar Square and most major spots in Kathmandu. I would highly recommend it for its warm hospitality. The staff constantly checked in to ensure I was having a great experience.
A special shout-out to Usha at the reception for her quick responses and regular follow-ups to make sure I was comfortable. I also loved the open space on the top floor, where Arjun kindly served me coffee along with a complimentary breakfast.
I‚Äôm truly happy with my stay and would definitely choose the same place again when I visit Kathmandu.

We stayed here several times between our travels around Nepal. The staff were super friendly and helpful and we could store our luggage without a problem. We stayed in the cheaper and the more expensive rooms and both are good value for money. The location is perfect if you want to shop things for trekking. They also have a travel agency in the hotel than can help you book buses and more for a fair price, but they don't push you to book tours/trips you don't really want.
One star is missing because there is mold in some of the rooms so maybe not too healthy if you plan to stay a long time.
